summary: This document is an email chain from June 30, 2020, among staff at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, discussing logistical planning for a press conference to announce criminal charges against Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails include a draft press advisory and coordination about the event location and COVID-19 safety protocols.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: She is the Acting U.S. Attorney who will be speaking at the press conference announcing charges against Ghislaine Maxwell. The email chain discusses her need for a walk-through of a potential venue.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the press conference, which will announce charges against her for her role in the sexual exploitation and abuse of multiple minor girls by Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the primary perpetrator whose abuse of minor girls Ghislaine Maxwell is accused of facilitating.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged for her role in facilitating the sexual exploitation and abuse of multiple minor girls by Epstein.
As Acting U.S. Attorney, Strauss is the lead prosecutor announcing criminal charges against Maxwell.

events.title: Press Conference Announcing Charges Against Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A press conference held by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to announce criminal charges against Ghislaine Maxwell for her role in the sexual exploitation and abuse of multiple minor girls by Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York
Duane Street (side of a building mentioned in logistical discussion)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York planned a press conference for July 1, 2020, to announce criminal charges against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The charges against Maxwell relate to her role in facilitating the sexual exploitation and abuse of multiple minor girls by Jeffrey Epstein.
Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss was the lead official scheduled to speak at the press conference.
The email chain reveals logistical planning challenges for the event, including venue selection (their office lobby vs. an FBI space) and implementing COVID-19 safety protocols.
The document is a draft advisory and internal coordination email, not a formal charging document or indictment.
